entry.title: The Machines Arena Game Preview: Is This the Next Overwatch?
entry.summary: Decrypt contributor Ryan S. Gladwin shares an inside look at The Machines Arena, an upcoming top-down 4v4 shooter from Directive Games that will offer NFTs minted on Ethereum sidechain network Ronin.

entry.title: You 'Have' to Be on Mobile: InfiniGods Cofounders on Gaming
entry.summary: InfiniGods developers Damon Gura and Owen O’Donoghue share their stance on why mobile gaming is essential to Web3 adoption and general success in the video games industry.

entry.title: Crypto Chaos of 2022 'Didn't Damage Technology Underlying the Industry': X Ventures Co-Founder Matthias Reiser
entry.summary: Ahead of this month's Proof of Talk event in Paris on June 14 and June 15, X Ventures co-founder and the event's co-organizer Dr. Matthias Reiser said nothing's changed for those with a "long-term view" of the industry. Still, events like the collapse of Terra and FTX in 20222 have certainly damaged investors' trust in crypto.

entry.title: Tron's Justin Sun Thinks Hong Kong Will Be a Big Fiat Onramp for Crypto
entry.summary: Justin Sun, Tron founder and advisor to crypto exchange Huobi, talks to Decrypt's Liam Kelly and Stacy Elliott about the impact of Hong Kong allowing residents to trade crypto, complications of restricting access based on location, and how AI will change the industry.

entry.title: NVIDIA's AI Push Could Change Gaming Forever
entry.summary: Computer tech firm NVIDIA profited off the crypto mining industry. Now, it's looking to artificial intelligence—and its stock price is soaring.

entry.title: Hong Kong, UAE Central Banks Coordinate on Crypto Regulations
entry.summary: Their focus on cross-border trade settlements could open up the possibility of central bank digital currencies being used.

entry.title: Controversial Stablecoin Issuer Tether Plans to Start Mining Bitcoin
entry.summary: Stablecoin issuers have accrued huge amounts of Bitcoin in the past—but it hasn't always gone to plan.

entry.title: Why InfiniGods Laughs at 'AAA' Web3 Games
entry.summary: The InfiniGods founders share their approach to game development and offer a critique of games that call themselves "AAA."

entry.title: Make it Fast, Make it Friendly: Jerome de Tychey Unpacks Key Themes at This Year's EthCC
entry.summary: After six years running, EthCC is back, this time in Paris from July 17 to July 20. Decrypt sat down with the brains behind one of Ethereum’s longest-running events Jerome de Tychey to get an inside look into what’s on the agenda this year, several unannounced guests, and the rollout of at least one “secret” DeFi project.

entry.title: KilroyPunk NFT Drop Mashes Up Iconic Meme With a CryptoPunk
entry.summary: Holograph unveils a collab between artist Eric Elms and the pseudonymous foobar—a multichain, open edition KilroyPunk NFT that spans eras.

entry.title: Nvidia Overtakes Meta, Tesla by Market Cap as Firm Captures AI Hype
entry.summary: As Nvidia edges towards the trillion-dollar club on the back of AI, it’s now more valuable than some of the market’s biggest names.

entry.title: USDC Backing Maker’s Stablecoin DAI Plummets to 23%
entry.summary: The decentralized stablecoin DAI is undergoing a massive shift as MakerDAO reduces USDC exposure and opts for U.S. Treasury bills.

entry.title: Bitcoin Trades at 18% Discount on Binance Australia as Exchange Cuts On-Ramp
entry.summary: Binance Australia's impending on-ramp service suspension has triggered a steep fall in Bitcoin's value in Australian Dollars.

entry.title: Russia Drops Plans for State-Run Crypto Exchange
entry.summary: After sending mixed signals, the government may be more willing to work with the cryptocurrency industry.

entry.title: Web3 Can Help Marginalized Communities Share Their Stories: Jordan Bayne
entry.summary: The award-winning filmmaker says blockchain tech provides a powerful way for artists to connect with audiences.

entry.title: PancakeSwap Launches Tower Defense Game—With CAKE Token Rewards
entry.summary: Pancake Protectors enlists the CAKE token to lure new users to Web3 gaming.

entry.title: Meet the Crypto Rich Who Want to Live Forever: Inside Vitalik's Zuzalu
entry.summary: Zuzalu attendees tell Decrypt about the secretive two-month gathering of tech leaders in a Montenegrin seaside town, which ended last week.

entry.title: Scientists Develop New Antibiotic To Kill Superbug Using AI
entry.summary: Machine learning enabled scientists to rapidly screen thousands of molecules to find a new antibacterial compound.

entry.title: Unioverse Game Preview: Hands-on With the Cinematic Proving Grounds
entry.summary: The Unioverse is a multimedia sci-fi franchise with plans to facilitate user-generated content. Decrypt reporter and GG producer Kate Irwin checked out the Unioverse as Reyu, an alien character, and navigated the Proving Grounds with him. In the Proving Grounds, you'll fight an array of different drone-like flying robots (some have tentacles!!) as you navigate the puzzle-like dystopian environment. Alien meets Portal, anyone?

entry.title: From Square Enix to Ubisoft: The Biggest Publishers Building NFT Games
entry.summary: The makers of Final Fantasy and Assassin's Creed, respectively, are leading the charge for traditional game publishers building in Web3.

entry.title: US Debt Ceiling Deal Blocks 30% Bitcoin Mining Tax: Congressman
entry.summary: The proposed Digital Asset Mining Energy tax has reportedly been taken off the table, according to U.S. Congressman Warren Davidson.

entry.title: Bali Tells Tourists: Don’t Pay With Crypto
entry.summary: Local authorities have warned that tourists who attempt to use crypto as a means of payment will be "dealt with firmly."

entry.title: Bitcoin Touches $28,000 as U.S. Debt Ceiling Deal Heads to Congress
entry.summary: Stock market indices rose to new yearly highs, while cryptocurrencies saw positive gains as risk-on sentiments returned.

entry.title: Americans May Not Love Crypto, But These Top Brands Are Into It
entry.summary: Chick-Fil-A, Toyota, Pfizer and Samsung are among the Top 100 brands to explore the cryptocurrency space.

entry.title: Bitcoin and Ethereum Rise as U.S. Lawmakers Scramble to Dodge Historic Debt Default
entry.summary: The potential compromise comes as America’s “X-date” approaches quickly.

entry.title: Web3 May Flip ‘Content Consumption on its Head,’ but Still Needs Traditional Media: MyCo Co-Founder
entry.summary: The streaming platform’s content lead said Web3 is still far from mainstream—and yields a unique opportunity.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Shaq Served with Two Crypto Lawsuits on Same Day
entry.summary: Some viral fake news in the form of an AI-generated explosion at the Pentagon briefly tanked Bitcoin’s price on Monday.

entry.title: You Can Earn Bitcoin by Playing Mobile Solitaire Games—Here's How Much
entry.summary: REVIEW: These iPhone and Android solitaire games reward you with real Bitcoin. We picked the best of the bunch.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum See Fourth Flat Week as TRON and Tether Surge
entry.summary: Republican presidential hopeful Ron DeSantis touched on cryptocurrencies in his Twitter Space with Elon Musk.

entry.title: Will Social Tokens Finally Click? Stealcam Is Betting on It
entry.summary: "Steal to reveal" platform Stealcam is rebranding and shifting gears. Can Friend.tech finally crack the social token model for creators?

entry.title: When DAOs Self-Execute—What Could Go Wrong?
entry.summary: Self-executing DAO proposals are the pinnacle of autonomy for decentralized communities. Still, the feature comes with a lot of baggage.

entry.title: Former EverQuest Lead: Games Must Be Co-Created With Players
entry.summary: Avalon's Jeffrey Butler says that the future of gaming, including the metaverse, will require players to co-create and be rewarded for it.

entry.title: Not Just Nvidia: These Are the Other Big Winners in the AI Chip Biz
entry.summary: COVID-19 was hell for tech stock and chip manufacturers. But AI has now flipped the script. Here are the companies benefiting the most so far.

entry.title: JP Morgan Files Patent for ChatGPT Finance Clone, IndexGPT
entry.summary: The bot would give financial advice on securities, investments, and monetary affairs.

entry.title: EverQuest Producer Jeffrey Butler on How Ready Player One Led Him to Web3 Project Avalon
entry.summary: Jeffrey Butler started his game development career producing EverQuest. Now, he's Avalon's Chief Product Officer. Butler told Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how he wants to create a customizable world where users can create their own worlds and in-game content.

entry.title: There's Now a Dollar-Backed Stablecoin on Bitcoin Using Ordinals Protocol
entry.summary: Stably debuted Stably USD in 2019. It's got a $7 million market capitalization across 11 blockchains, according to its April attestation.

entry.title: Grand Theft Auto 6 Crypto Rumors Are Swirling Again—Here’s What’s Going On
entry.summary: Rumors suggest that Rockstar Games' anticipated Grand Theft Auto 6 will feature cryptocurrency. Is there any truth to the claims?

entry.title: Esports Orgs Should Become More Like Tech Companies: Community Gaming CEO
entry.summary: Community Gaming CEO and 3XP conference organizer Chris Gonsalves believes crypto and tech could rejuvenate and reinvent the esports industry. In an interview, he tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin why he thinks esports organizations should shake up their approach.

entry.title: European Securities Regulator Raises Concerns Over Crypto Products Ahead of MiCA Rollout
entry.summary: Despite the adoption of MiCA, ESMA said today firms must still label crypto offerings as unregulated until the framework is implemented.

entry.title: Binance Expects to Launch New Thai Crypto Exchange in Q4 2023
entry.summary: After landing a crypto operator's license in Thailand today, Binance Gulf is expected to open its doors at the end of this year.

entry.title: Ethereum, Bitcoin Balances on Exchanges Edges Toward 5-Year Low
entry.summary: The collapse of FTX, the rise in self-custody interest, and Ethereum’s latest upgrade appear to be fueling the latest exchange exodus.

entry.title: Crypto Exchange Gemini Turns to Ireland for European Headquarters
entry.summary: Amid increasing regulatory pressure in the U.S., the Winklevoss twins see the Emerald Isle as an “entry point” into the rest of Europe.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Hold Ground as $3.5 Billion in Options Expire
entry.summary: With billions in Bitcoin and Ethereum options expiring today, analysts expected the worst.

entry.title: What's the Environmental Impact of Generative AI Tools?
entry.summary: Will ChatGPT and other generative AI tools make an outsized impact on the planet? Maybe—but there's reason for optimism, too.

entry.title: Ordinals Is Drawing Former Ethereum Devs to Build on Bitcoin
entry.summary: The buzzy Bitcoin protocol is attracting talent from across the Web3 ecosystem.

entry.title: Ubisoft's Rabbids Invade Reddit as Free NFTs
entry.summary: Reddit released a limited quantity of free Rabbids avatar NFTs and users are scooping them up, with multiple varieties already depleted.

entry.title: Mojo Melee Game Preview: Hands-on With the Casual Web3 Auto Battler
entry.summary: Mojo Melee is an auto battler game that offers Polygon NFTs. Decrypt contributor Ryan S. Gladwin playtested the game in beta and offers his thoughts on the gameplay experience.

entry.title: No Virginia, Ron DeSantis's Campaign Didn't Alter His Video With AI
entry.summary: They used good old-fashioned digital editing tools instead.

entry.title: Mojo Melee Puts a Casual Spin on Teamfight Tactics-Style Auto Battlers
entry.summary: PREVIEW: The NFT-infused Mojo Melee is simple in its beta state, but that makes it a good introduction to a complex genre.

entry.title: How 3XP Plans to Reshape Crypto's Reputation Among Gamers
entry.summary: Community Gaming CEO and 3XP organizer Chris Gonsalves tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the first 3XP video game conference, which aims to bring together fans of crypto-enabled video games, influencers, game developers, blockchain firms, and gamers under one roof in Pasadena, California from June 8-9, 2023.

entry.title: Mark Otero Shares Why a16z Invested in Azra Games' Approach to Gaming
entry.summary: What is Azra Games' approach to NFTs in gaming? Azra Games CEO Mark Otero shares his vision and why he believes his approach was a key reason Azra received investment from venture capital firms like Andreessen Horowitz (a16z).

entry.title: Funding Web3 Film Calladita With Traditional Systems 'Wasn't Working', Says Director Miguel Faus
entry.summary: Spanish Film Director Miguel Faus talks with Decrypt about how he financed his movie “Calladita” with NFTs. In his view, Web3 and blockchain allow creators to get around some of the key difficulties present in the traditional movie industry, specifically finding funding.

entry.title: 'Web3 Offers Something Hollywood Does Not': Film3 Pioneer, Filmmaker Jordan Bayne
entry.summary: Film3 pioneer, Metacannes and The Squad founder, Jordan Bayne discusses the advantages that crypto offers to filmmakers, notably owning their work's IP throughout the entire creation, production, and distribution processes.

entry.title: Film3 Offers 'a Whole Bunch of Independent Filmmakers' Hope, Says First Flights Co-founder Nick Sadler
entry.summary: First Flights co-founder Nick Sadler sat down with Decrypt at this year's MetaCannes festival to discuss how Web3 can support independent filmmakers by leveraging its unique blockchain-powered crowdfunding platform.

entry.title: The Film3 Movement 'Doesn't Need Competitors, it Needs Collaborators': Bingeable CEO, Founder Stephen Murray
entry.summary: Founder and CEO of Bingeable Stephen Murray unpacks how creators and filmmakers can lower the barriers for audiences to connect with their work. "Within two clicks on hearing about the movie, you're watching it," he told Decrypt at this year's MetaCannes festival.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: Defining The Web3 Stack
entry.summary: In this video, part of Infura’s Web3 Dev Series, you’ll learn how to define the web3 stack in order to build full stack decentralized applications. Author: Clarissa Watson, Senior Writer at ConsenSys.

entry.title: 'Web3 Creates a Tighter Bond' Between Audiences, Creators: MyCo CCO
entry.summary: MyCo’s streaming platform CCO Phil McKenzie talks with Decrypt about the Film3 movement and the Metacannes festival he helped to organize occurring alongside the Festival de Cannes. He explains how Web3 can help creators to find funding and create new ways to interact with the audience.

entry.title: Immutable's Chris Clay: Crypto Can Solve the 'Dreaded Rollback' in MMORPGs
entry.summary: Immutable VP and Gods Unchained Game Director Chris Clay tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how Immutable is actually immutable—and how that changes everything for both developers and players.
